Thank you for your support! See you at Players' Theatre on April 19 and 20.

story:
Dance Scholar and Photographer

I'm Katie Stahl-Kovell, a 2nd year PHD Critical Dance Studies and MA Southeast Asian Studies student at the University of California, Riverside. My dissertation work focuses on Cambodian Classical dance, a dance that is very much alive today in Cambodia and around the world.

Khmer Classical dance dates back to arguably the 6th century CE. It was a royal court dance and was viably threatened during the Khmer Rouge Genocide from 1975-1979. Over 2 million people were killed.  Over 90% of dance artisans were murdered during this era.  Many dancers who managed to survive, such as Sophiline Cheam Shapiro--a famous dance choreographer and performer who started Khmer Arts--have dedicated their lives to the preservation of this beautiful and ancient dance.

I have conducted ethnographic fieldwork with the Cambodian community in Long Beach, CA USA for almost three years, now.  I learn Khmer Classical dance from Prumsodun Ok, who is the student of Sophiline Cheam Shapiro, at Khmer Arts Academy in Long Beach, CA.  The Academy is the community based sister-school to the professional organization in Cambodia--where I will be photo documenting dance. 

For the past three years I have photographed dancers in Long Beach.  This project's focus in on Khmer Arts Ensemble--the professional troupe in Cambodia.

The Project: A Self-Published Photo-Book!

This Summer I'm headed to Phnom Penh to:

  1. Intensively study the Khmer language, the language of Cambodia, at the Center for Khmer Studies in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  This six-week intensive language and culture program will train me to speak, read, and write Khmer at a conversational level.
  2. Photo document Cambodian Classical dancers in professional ensembles such as Khmer Arts Ensemble.

In Fall 2013 or early 2014 the photographs I take in Cambodia will be published into a full color print book to buy!

Why Do We Need this Photo-Book?

There is a great lack of accurate information and current photography of Cambodian Classical dance and dancers. The GOAL for this project is to publish my photographic work into a photo-book that is affordable and informative. The intended audiences for the photo-book are 1) Cambodian Community members including Khmer Classical dancers, 2) Cambodian Elementary Educators and Students, & 3) United States Elementary Educators and Students. 

I hope to have enough funding to provide several elementary schools and orphanages within Cambodian and within the United States with free copies of this book.

The captions of the photos will be in English. If funding allows, I will hire a translator to translate descriptions of the photos into Khmer and possibly French.

Fund this Community Based Project!

I have asked for $3500 to cover my air travel to Cambodia, part of my room & board, and extracurricular costs (such as donations to the dance associations I work with). 

My air travel: $1900 + my accomodations: $1200 for three months + estimated extracurricular costs associated with the dancers: $400.  Indiegogo takes 4% of the total funds raised.

My camera equipment is funded by me, without the aid of Indiegogo. The funding will be strictly used for travel, room & board, and costs associated with working with the dancers.

There are MANY perks for funding this community based project! Check it out to the right--do not hesitate to e-mail me at kstah001@ucr.edu if you have any queries.

***Each person who donates will have their name written in the acknowledgements of the book!

Who Gets the Proceeds?

Upon publishing this book, the proceeds will go back to help fund the dancers and dance associations/professional organizations such as Khmer Arts Ensemble.  I will not keep any of the proceeds.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Please spread the word about this project! I am very excited to not only have the privilege to travel to Cambodia, but also to have the wonderful Cambodian Community in Long Beach, California supporting me.

***Thank you to Khmer Arts Academy for allowing me to take photos of the dancers in Long Beach, CA for the past 3 years!  The photos used in this campaign are of Long Beach based dancers.

story:
The MARRIED SEX PROJECT is a touring one-person play--combined with outreach--that promotes sexual health, sexual healing, and open conversation about sex. 


It's also one of New York.com's 7 reasons to stay in NYC this summer!

 

More About MARRIED SEX, the Play

My name is Laura Zam and for the last 20 years I've been creating one-person pieces for the stage that deal with social issues. I've performed my work in many well-known venues, including the Kennedy Center, the National Theatre, and Off-Broadway. MARRIED SEX is the culmination of all this work. It is my life's work!  In MARRIED SEX, I portray 30 people who have questions about sex. This play was commissioned by a professional theater in DC, Theater J, directed by Shirley Serotsky. After sold-out shows in DC and a stop in Minneapolis, this play is opening in the New York International Fringe Festival. (This festival is very difficult to get into, and I am honored to be a part of it.) MARRIED SEX was also was a semi-finalist for a very prestigious honor: The O'Neill National Playwrights Conference.

 

Why I Wrote This Play

When I was very young I experienced sexual abuse perpetrated by two neighbors. In the years since, I have asked many questions about sex, relationships and sexual trauma. Luckily, I have found some answers. I wrote MARRIED SEX not just to entertain (the show is audaciously funny), but also to help people who have experienced trauma. MARRIED SEX is equally for people who just have questions about sex. Let's face it: sex and relationships are confusing... and absurdly funny.

 

This project answers questions about sex -- and it does so with humor! Here is a link to a listing in the New York International Fringe Festival!

 

What if I'm Not Married? 

MARRIED SEX, true to its name, is about long-term relationships. However, it's also about pleasure, intimacy and love, especially in relationship with ourselves!  The play is about all the things we are married to--our baggage, our hope, our ability to transform ourselves and each other.

 

What is the Larger Project?

The project built around this play combines theater with innovative outreach that includes informational e-books, a published memoir, and brunches that provide sex ed for adults--often with mimosas! 

My mission is to Tame the Shame associated with discussions around sex.

 

More About Me

Over the past two decades I've won many awards and honors, including a Tennesse Williams Fellowship, an Open Society Fund grant and an Artist Fellowship from the DC Commmission on the Arts and Humanities.  I've been featured on NPR, in the Huffington Post, and have had my work filmed for ABC-TV. Also, for the past 15 years, I have worked directly with trauma survivors, urban teens, and regular ol' folks, using writing and performance as expressive/healing modalities. Want to know more about my work? Check out some of my reviews/press in the pre-Bezos Washington Post (and other publications), all on my website:

 

Your Funding Goes a Loooong Way

I'm happy to invite you to join the growing community of friends that have burst through taboo by helping to bring this fun and poignant show to audiences around the country. Your generous support will help pay for costs associated with a production in the prestigious New York International Fringe Festival (August, 2013). Expenses include a production crew, company manager, graphic design, advertising, fireproofing, costumes, and more!  But your funding is not just for this New York show; it will also cover some expenses associated with an upcoming tour (international dates to be announced soon!). PLUS, your amazing funding will:

  • Pay expenses for free Sex Brunches. These sassy meals, which I will offer around the country, provide a space where women (and men) can learn about and discuss sexual health and healing.

  • Offset costs for free writing workshops, offered to survivors of sexual abuse/assault (and the people who work with them) as a way to help with coping and healing (in conjunction with all MARRIED SEX performances).
  • Pay production costs for the development of two e-books. One is packed full of fun and funny life tips, and the other provides a comprehensive overview with regard to healing from all kinds of trauma. But I don't stop there. Your contribution will also provide research funding as I expand this powerful show into a full-length manuscript, with a target date for bookshelves in 2015.
  • Pay for an overhaul my website and blog. Help me dispense more information about sex, open-communication, happiness, and the pursuit of sexual health.

 

More About What's in it for You

So, take a look to your right and see the list of rewards that I can happily share with my generous donors. Want to support the show but money is a bit tight? Donate $10 and get a shout out on my website/blog. $20 gets you an autographed limited edition Married Sex bookmark. Want something more participatory? $200 gets you a 30-minute storytelling session via phone or Skype (where you can learn to tell your own story). With gifts ranging from $10 to $2500 (you could be an Associate Producer or a Big-Time Producer!), your contribution will make you a part of something special.

Your gift at any level helps bring this show with its fun path to sexual happiness and healing to a broad audience. MARRIED SEX is entertaining, empowering and enlightening. Every dollar you share helps thousands of people laugh and love--themselves and their partners.

 

Some Extra Stuff

Now, you may be wondering what will happen if we don't meet our goal. Well, let's not consider that a possibility! Share this campaign page with your Facebook friends, tweet like you've never tweeted before, and tell everyone you know! But should we fall short of the goal, rewards will be filled and production and touring will definitely go on. I am 100% committed to bringing The MARRIED SEX Project all around the globe and will empty my bank account to make that happen. But, do a girl a favor and let's make sure I don't have too!

For updates on the campaign and to learn more about the amazing rewards that I am offering, visit LauraZam.com or www.facebook.com/marriedsexplay for details!

story:
My name is Deborah Corrales and I have reached the pinnacle of my education at Cornish College of the Arts. As a graduating senior of the class of 2013 in the dance department, I am seeking to raise funds to cover the neccessary expenses of my senior thesis. The thesis consists of a group piece ( choreographed by myself), and a solo piece (guest choreographer ).

The funds will be used to hire the guest choregrapher, rights and/or the hiring of a composer for the music, costuming, and the renting of rehearsal space.

This experience is not only neccesary to my education, but to my growth as an artist, and as a working dancer in the professional world. This piece will give me the oppurtunity to work with a professional in the choregraphy/dance world, and help to further build my resume before I advance in my career.

As a graduating senior of the class of 2013 in the dance department, I am seeking to raise funds to cover the neccessary expenses of my senior thesis. The thesis consists of a group piece ( choreographed by myself), and a solo piece (guest choreographer ).
The funds will be used to hire the guest choregrapher, rights and/or the hiring of a composer for the music, costuming, and the renting of rehearsal space.
This experience is not only neccesary to my education, but to my growth as an artist, and as a working dancer in the professional world. This piece will give me the oppurtunity to work with a professional in the choregraphy/dance world, and help to further build my resume before I advance in my career.
